tinyfiledialogs.cpp
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 /* this file can be renamed with extension ".cpp" and compiled as C++.
2 The code is 100% compatible C C++
3 (just comment out << extern "C" >> in the header file) */
4 
5 /*_________
6  / \ tinyfiledialogs.c v3.8.8 [Apr 22, 2021] zlib licence
7  |tiny file| Unique code file created [November 9, 2014]
8  | dialogs | Copyright (c) 2014 - 2021 Guillaume Vareille http://ysengrin.com
9  \____ ___/ http://tinyfiledialogs.sourceforge.net
10  \| git clone http://git.code.sf.net/p/tinyfiledialogs/code tinyfd
11  ____________________________________________
12  | |
13  | email: tinyfiledialogs at ysengrin.com |
14  |____________________________________________|
15  _________________________________________________________________________________
16  | |
17  | the windows only wchar_t UTF-16 prototypes are at the bottom of the header file |
18  |_________________________________________________________________________________|
19  _________________________________________________________
20  | |
21  | on windows: - since v3.6 char is UTF-8 by default |
22  | - if you want MBCS set tinyfd_winUtf8 to 0 |
23  | - functions like fopen expect MBCS |
24  |_________________________________________________________|

27 https://stackoverflow.com/a/47651444

59 #define _POSIX_C_SOURCE 2 /* to accept POSIX 2 in old ANSI C standards */
60 #endif
61 #endif

64 #if !defined(_GNU_SOURCE)
65  #define _GNU_SOURCE /* used only to resolve symbolic links. Can be commented out */
66 #endif

69 #include <stdio.h>
70 #include <stdlib.h>
71 #include <string.h>
72 #include <ctype.h>
73 #include <sys/stat.h>

75 #ifdef _WIN32
76  #ifdef __BORLANDC__
77  #define _getch getch
78  #endif
79  #ifndef _WIN32_WINNT
80  #define _WIN32_WINNT 0x0500
81  #endif
82  #include <windows.h>
83  #include <commdlg.h>
84  #include <shlobj.h>
85  #include <conio.h>
86  #include <direct.h>
87  #define TINYFD_NOCCSUNICODE
88  #define SLASH "\\"
89 #else
90  #include <limits.h>
91  #include <unistd.h>
92  #include <dirent.h> /* on old systems try <sys/dir.h> instead */
93  #include <termios.h>
94  #include <sys/utsname.h>
95  #include <signal.h> /* on old systems try <sys/signal.h> instead */
96  #define SLASH "/"
97 #endif /* _WIN32 */

101 #define MAX_PATH_OR_CMD 1024 /* _MAX_PATH or MAX_PATH */
102 
103 #ifndef MAX_MULTIPLE_FILES
104 #define MAX_MULTIPLE_FILES 1024

106 #define LOW_MULTIPLE_FILES 32

112 
113 char tinyfd_version[8] = "3.8.8";
114 
115 /******************************************************************************************************/
116 /**************************************** UTF-8 on Windows ********************************************/
117 /******************************************************************************************************/
118 #ifdef _WIN32
119 /* if you want to use UTF-8 ( instead of the UTF-16/wchar_t functions at the end of tinyfiledialogs.h )
120 Make sure your code is really prepared for UTF-8 (on windows, functions like fopen() expect MBCS and not UTF-8) */
121 int tinyfd_winUtf8 = 1; /* on windows char strings can be 1:UTF-8(default) or 0:MBCS */
122 /* for MBCS change this to 0, here or in your code */
123 #endif
124 /******************************************************************************************************/
125 /******************************************************************************************************/
126 /******************************************************************************************************/
127 
128 int tinyfd_verbose = 0 ; /* on unix: prints the command line calls */
129 int tinyfd_silent = 1 ; /* 1 (default) or 0 : on unix, hide errors and warnings from called dialogs */
130 
131 /* Curses dialogs are difficult to use, on windows they are only ascii and uses the unix backslah */
132 int tinyfd_allowCursesDialogs = 0 ; /* 0 (default) or 1 */
133 int tinyfd_forceConsole = 0 ; /* 0 (default) or 1 */
134 /* for unix & windows: 0 (graphic mode) or 1 (console mode).
135 0: try to use a graphic solution, if it fails then it uses console mode.
136 1: forces all dialogs into console mode even when the X server is present.
137  it can use the package dialog or dialog.exe.
138  on windows it only make sense for console applications */
139 
140 int tinyfd_assumeGraphicDisplay = 0; /* 0 (default) or 1 */
141 /* some systems don't set the environment variable DISPLAY even when a graphic display is present.
142 set this to 1 to tell tinyfiledialogs to assume the existence of a graphic display */
143 
144 
145 char tinyfd_response[1024];
146 /* if you pass "tinyfd_query" as aTitle,
147 the functions will not display the dialogs
148 but and return 0 for console mode, 1 for graphic mode.
149 tinyfd_response is then filled with the retain solution.
150 possible values for tinyfd_response are (all lowercase)
151 for graphic mode:
152  windows_wchar windows applescript kdialog zenity zenity3 matedialog
153  shellementary qarma yad python2-tkinter python3-tkinter python-dbus
154  perl-dbus gxmessage gmessage xmessage xdialog gdialog
155 for console mode:
156  dialog whiptail basicinput no_solution */
157 
158 static int gWarningDisplayed = 0 ;
159 static char gTitle[]="missing software! (we will try basic console input)";
160 
161 #ifdef _WIN32
162 char tinyfd_needs[] = "\
163  ___________\n\
164 / \\ \n\
165 | tiny file |\n\
166 | dialogs |\n\
167 \\_____ ____/\n\
168  \\|\
169 \ntiny file dialogs on Windows needs:\
170 \n a graphic display\
171 \nor dialog.exe (curses console mode)\
172 \nor a console for basic input";
173 #else
174 char tinyfd_needs[] = "\
175  ___________\n\
176 / \\ \n\
177 | tiny file |\n\
178 | dialogs |\n\
179 \\_____ ____/\n\
180  \\|\
181 \ntiny file dialogs on UNIX needs:\
182 \n applescript or kdialog or yad or Xdialog\
183 \nor zenity (or matedialog or shellementary or qarma)\
184 \nor python (2 or 3) + tkinter + python-dbus (optional)\
185 \nor dialog (opens console if needed)\
186 \nor xterm + bash (opens console for basic input)\
187 \nor existing console for basic input";
188 #endif
189 
190 #ifdef _MSC_VER
191 #pragma warning(disable:4996) /* allows usage of strncpy, strcpy, strcat, sprintf, fopen */
192 #pragma warning(disable:4100) /* allows usage of strncpy, strcpy, strcat, sprintf, fopen */
193 #pragma warning(disable:4706) /* allows usage of strncpy, strcpy, strcat, sprintf, fopen */
194 #endif
195 
196 static int getenvDISPLAY(void)
197 {
198  return tinyfd_assumeGraphicDisplay || getenv("DISPLAY");
199 }
200 
201 
202 static char * getCurDir(void)
203 {
204  static char lCurDir[MAX_PATH_OR_CMD];
205  return getcwd(lCurDir, sizeof(lCurDir));
206 }
207 
208 
209 static char * getPathWithoutFinalSlash(
210  char * aoDestination, /* make sure it is allocated, use _MAX_PATH */
211  char const * aSource) /* aoDestination and aSource can be the same */
212 {
213  char const * lTmp ;
214  if ( aSource )
215  {
216  lTmp = strrchr(aSource, '/');
217  if (!lTmp)
218  {
219  lTmp = strrchr(aSource, '\\');
220  }
221  if (lTmp)
222  {
223  strncpy(aoDestination, aSource, lTmp - aSource );
224  aoDestination[lTmp - aSource] = '\0';
225  }
226  else
227  {
228  * aoDestination = '\0';
229  }
230  }
231  else
232  {
233  * aoDestination = '\0';
234  }
235  return aoDestination;
236 }
237 
238 
239 static char * getLastName(
240  char * aoDestination, /* make sure it is allocated */
241  char const * aSource)
242 {
243  /* copy the last name after '/' or '\' */
244  char const * lTmp ;
245  if ( aSource )
246  {
247  lTmp = strrchr(aSource, '/');
248  if (!lTmp)
249  {
250  lTmp = strrchr(aSource, '\\');
251  }
252  if (lTmp)
253  {
254  strcpy(aoDestination, lTmp + 1);
255  }
256  else
257  {
258  strcpy(aoDestination, aSource);
259  }
260  }
261  else
262  {
263  * aoDestination = '\0';
264  }
265  return aoDestination;
266 }
267 
268 
269 static void ensureFinalSlash( char * aioString )
270 {
271  if ( aioString && strlen( aioString ) )
272  {
273  char * lastcar = aioString + strlen( aioString ) - 1 ;
274  if ( strncmp( lastcar , SLASH , 1 ) )
275  {
276  strcat( lastcar , SLASH ) ;
277  }
278  }
279 }
280 
281 
282 static void Hex2RGB( char const aHexRGB[8] , unsigned char aoResultRGB[3] )
283 {
284  char lColorChannel[8] ;
285  if ( aoResultRGB )
286  {
287  if ( aHexRGB )
288  {
289  strcpy(lColorChannel, aHexRGB ) ;
290  aoResultRGB[2] = (unsigned char)strtoul(lColorChannel+5,NULL,16);
291  lColorChannel[5] = '\0';
292  aoResultRGB[1] = (unsigned char)strtoul(lColorChannel+3,NULL,16);
293  lColorChannel[3] = '\0';
294  aoResultRGB[0] = (unsigned char)strtoul(lColorChannel+1,NULL,16);
295 /* printf("%d %d %d\n", aoResultRGB[0], aoResultRGB[1], aoResultRGB[2]); */
296  }
297  else
298  {
299  aoResultRGB[0]=0;
300  aoResultRGB[1]=0;
301  aoResultRGB[2]=0;
302  }
303  }
304 }
305 
306 static void RGB2Hex( unsigned char const aRGB[3], char aoResultHexRGB[8] )
307 {
308  if ( aoResultHexRGB )
309  {
310  if ( aRGB )
311  {
312 #if (defined(__cplusplus ) && __cplusplus >= 201103L) || (defined(__STDC_VERSION__) && __STDC_VERSION__ >= 199901L) || defined(__clang__)
313  sprintf(aoResultHexRGB, "#%02hhx%02hhx%02hhx", aRGB[0], aRGB[1], aRGB[2]);
314 #else
315  sprintf(aoResultHexRGB, "#%02hx%02hx%02hx", aRGB[0], aRGB[1], aRGB[2]);
316 #endif
317  /*printf("aoResultHexRGB %s\n", aoResultHexRGB);*/
318  }
319  else
320  {
321  aoResultHexRGB[0]=0;
322  aoResultHexRGB[1]=0;
323  aoResultHexRGB[2]=0;
324  }
325  }
326 }
327 
328 
329 void tfd_replaceSubStr( char const * aSource, char const * aOldSubStr,
330  char const * aNewSubStr, char * aoDestination )
331 {
332  char const * pOccurence ;
333  char const * p ;
334  char const * lNewSubStr = "" ;
335  size_t lOldSubLen = strlen( aOldSubStr ) ;
336 
337  if ( ! aSource )
338  {
339  * aoDestination = '\0' ;
340  return ;
341  }
342  if ( ! aOldSubStr )
343  {
344  strcpy( aoDestination , aSource ) ;
345  return ;
346  }
347  if ( aNewSubStr )
348  {
349  lNewSubStr = aNewSubStr ;
350  }
351  p = aSource ;
352  * aoDestination = '\0' ;
353  while ( ( pOccurence = strstr( p , aOldSubStr ) ) != NULL )
354  {
355  strncat( aoDestination , p , pOccurence - p ) ;
356  strcat( aoDestination , lNewSubStr ) ;
357  p = pOccurence + lOldSubLen ;
358  }
359  strcat( aoDestination , p ) ;
360 }
361 
362 
363 static int filenameValid( char const * aFileNameWithoutPath )
364 {
365  if ( ! aFileNameWithoutPath
366  || ! strlen(aFileNameWithoutPath)
367  || strpbrk(aFileNameWithoutPath , "\\/:*?\"<>|") )
368  {
369  return 0 ;
370  }
371  return 1 ;
372 }
373 
374 #ifndef _WIN32
375 
376 static int fileExists( char const * aFilePathAndName )
377 {
378  FILE * lIn ;
379  if ( ! aFilePathAndName || ! strlen(aFilePathAndName) )
380  {
381  return 0 ;
382  }
383  lIn = fopen( aFilePathAndName , "r" ) ;
384  if ( ! lIn )
385  {
386  return 0 ;
387  }
388  fclose( lIn ) ;
389  return 1 ;
390 }
391 
392 #endif
393 
394 
395 static void wipefile(char const * aFilename)
396 {
397  int i;
398  struct stat st;
399  FILE * lIn;
400 
401  if (stat(aFilename, &st) == 0)
402  {
403  if ((lIn = fopen(aFilename, "w")))
404  {
405  for (i = 0; i < st.st_size; i++)
406  {
407  fputc('A', lIn);
408  }
409  fclose(lIn);
410  }
411  }
412 }
413 
414 
415 int tfd_quoteDetected(char const * aString)
416 {
417  char const * p;
418 
419  if (!aString) return 0;
420 
421  p = aString;
422  while ((p = strchr(p, '\'')))
423  {
424  return 1;
425  }
426 
427  p = aString;
428  while ((p = strchr(p, '\"')))
429  {
430  return 1;
431  }
432 
433  return 0;
434 }
435 
436 
437 char const * tinyfd_getGlobalChar(char const * aCharVariableName) /* to be called from C# (you don't need this in C or C++) */
438 {
439  if (!aCharVariableName || !strlen(aCharVariableName)) return NULL;
440  else if (!strcmp(aCharVariableName, "tinyfd_version")) return tinyfd_version;
441  else if (!strcmp(aCharVariableName, "tinyfd_needs")) return tinyfd_needs;
442  else if (!strcmp(aCharVariableName, "tinyfd_response")) return tinyfd_response;
443  else return NULL ;
444 }
445 
446 
447 int tinyfd_getGlobalInt(char const * aIntVariableName) /* to be called from C# (you don't need this in C or C++) */
448 {
449  if ( !aIntVariableName || !strlen(aIntVariableName) ) return -1 ;
450  else if ( !strcmp(aIntVariableName, "tinyfd_verbose") ) return tinyfd_verbose ;
451  else if ( !strcmp(aIntVariableName, "tinyfd_silent") ) return tinyfd_silent ;
452  else if ( !strcmp(aIntVariableName, "tinyfd_allowCursesDialogs") ) return tinyfd_allowCursesDialogs ;
453  else if ( !strcmp(aIntVariableName, "tinyfd_forceConsole") ) return tinyfd_forceConsole ;
454  else if ( !strcmp(aIntVariableName, "tinyfd_assumeGraphicDisplay") ) return tinyfd_assumeGraphicDisplay ;
455 #ifdef _WIN32
456  else if ( !strcmp(aIntVariableName, "tinyfd_winUtf8") ) return tinyfd_winUtf8 ;
457 #endif
458  else return -1;
459 }
460 
461 
462 int tinyfd_setGlobalInt(char const * aIntVariableName, int aValue) /* to be called from C# (you don't need this in C or C++) */
463 {
464  if (!aIntVariableName || !strlen(aIntVariableName)) return -1 ;
465  else if (!strcmp(aIntVariableName, "tinyfd_verbose")) { tinyfd_verbose = aValue; return tinyfd_verbose; }
466  else if (!strcmp(aIntVariableName, "tinyfd_silent")) { tinyfd_silent = aValue; return tinyfd_silent; }
467  else if (!strcmp(aIntVariableName, "tinyfd_allowCursesDialogs")) { tinyfd_allowCursesDialogs = aValue; return tinyfd_allowCursesDialogs; }
468  else if (!strcmp(aIntVariableName, "tinyfd_forceConsole")) { tinyfd_forceConsole = aValue; return tinyfd_forceConsole; }
469  else if (!strcmp(aIntVariableName, "tinyfd_assumeGraphicDisplay")) { tinyfd_assumeGraphicDisplay = aValue; return tinyfd_assumeGraphicDisplay; }
470 #ifdef _WIN32
471  else if (!strcmp(aIntVariableName, "tinyfd_winUtf8")) { tinyfd_winUtf8 = aValue; return tinyfd_winUtf8; }
472 #endif
473  else return -1;
474 }
475 
476 
477 #ifdef _WIN32
478 static int powershellPresent(void)
479 { /*only on vista and above (or installed on xp)*/
480  static int lPowershellPresent = -1;
481  char lBuff[MAX_PATH_OR_CMD];
482  FILE* lIn;
483  char const* lString = "powershell.exe";
484 
485  if (lPowershellPresent < 0)
486  {
487  if (!(lIn = _popen("where powershell.exe", "r")))
488  {
489  lPowershellPresent = 0;
490  return 0;
491  }
492  while (fgets(lBuff, sizeof(lBuff), lIn) != NULL)
493  {
494  }
495  _pclose(lIn);
496  if (lBuff[strlen(lBuff) - 1] == '\n')
497  {
498  lBuff[strlen(lBuff) - 1] = '\0';
499  }
500  if (strcmp(lBuff + strlen(lBuff) - strlen(lString), lString))
501  {
502  lPowershellPresent = 0;
503  }
504  else
505  {
506  lPowershellPresent = 1;
507  }
508  }
509  return lPowershellPresent;
510 }
511 
512 static int windowsVersion(void)
513 {
514 #if !defined(__MINGW32__) || defined(__MINGW64_VERSION_MAJOR)
515  typedef LONG NTSTATUS ;
516  typedef NTSTATUS(WINAPI* RtlGetVersionPtr)(PRTL_OSVERSIONINFOW);
517  HMODULE hMod;
518  RtlGetVersionPtr lFxPtr;
519  RTL_OSVERSIONINFOW lRovi = { 0 };
520 
521  hMod = GetModuleHandleW(L"ntdll.dll");
522  if (hMod) {
523  lFxPtr = (RtlGetVersionPtr)GetProcAddress(hMod, "RtlGetVersion");
524  if (lFxPtr)
525  {
526  lRovi.dwOSVersionInfoSize = sizeof(lRovi);
527  if (!lFxPtr(&lRovi))
528  {
529  return lRovi.dwMajorVersion;
530  }
531  }
532  }
533 #endif
534  if (powershellPresent()) return 6; /*minimum is vista or installed on xp*/
535  return 0;
536 }
537 
538 
539 static void replaceChr(char * aString, char aOldChr, char aNewChr)
540 {
541  char * p;
542 
543  if (!aString) return;
544  if (aOldChr == aNewChr) return;
545 
546  p = aString;
547  while ((p = strchr(p, aOldChr)))
548  {
549  *p = aNewChr;
550  p++;
551  }
552  return;
553 }
554 
555 
556 #if !defined(WC_ERR_INVALID_CHARS)
557 /* undefined prior to Vista, so not yet in MINGW header file */
558 #define WC_ERR_INVALID_CHARS 0x00000000 /* 0x00000080 for MINGW maybe ? */
559 #endif
560 
561 static int sizeUtf16From8(char const * aUtf8string)
562 {
563  return MultiByteToWideChar(CP_UTF8, MB_ERR_INVALID_CHARS,
564  aUtf8string, -1, NULL, 0);
565 }
566 
567 
568 static int sizeUtf16FromMbcs(char const * aMbcsString)
569 {
570  return MultiByteToWideChar(CP_ACP, MB_ERR_INVALID_CHARS,
571  aMbcsString, -1, NULL, 0);
572 }
573 
574 
575 static int sizeUtf8(wchar_t const * aUtf16string)
576 {
577  return WideCharToMultiByte(CP_UTF8, WC_ERR_INVALID_CHARS,
578  aUtf16string, -1, NULL, 0, NULL, NULL);
579 }
580 
581 
582 static int sizeMbcs(wchar_t const * aMbcsString)
583 {
584  int lRes = WideCharToMultiByte(CP_ACP, 0,
585  aMbcsString, -1, NULL, 0, NULL, NULL);
586  /* DWORD licic = GetLastError(); */
587  return lRes;
588 }
589 
590 
591 wchar_t* tinyfd_mbcsTo16(char const* aMbcsString)
592 {
593  static wchar_t* lMbcsString = NULL;
594  int lSize;
595 
596  free(lMbcsString);
597  if (!aMbcsString) { lMbcsString = NULL; return NULL; }
598  lSize = sizeUtf16FromMbcs(aMbcsString);
599  if (lSize)
600  {
601  lMbcsString = (wchar_t*)malloc(lSize * sizeof(wchar_t));
602  lSize = MultiByteToWideChar(CP_ACP, 0, aMbcsString, -1, lMbcsString, lSize);
603  }
604  else wcscpy(lMbcsString, L"");
605  return lMbcsString;
606 }
607 
608 
609 wchar_t * tinyfd_utf8to16(char const * aUtf8string)
610 {
611  static wchar_t * lUtf16string = NULL;
612  int lSize;
613 
614  free(lUtf16string);
615  if (!aUtf8string) {lUtf16string = NULL; return NULL;}
616  lSize = sizeUtf16From8(aUtf8string);
617  if (lSize)
618  {
619  lUtf16string = (wchar_t*)malloc(lSize * sizeof(wchar_t));
620  lSize = MultiByteToWideChar(CP_UTF8, MB_ERR_INVALID_CHARS,
621  aUtf8string, -1, lUtf16string, lSize);
622  return lUtf16string;
623  }
624  else
625  {
626  /* let's try mbcs anyway */
627  lUtf16string = NULL;
628  return tinyfd_mbcsTo16(aUtf8string);
629  }
630 }
631 
632 
633 char * tinyfd_utf16toMbcs(wchar_t const * aUtf16string)
634 {
635  static char * lMbcsString = NULL;
636  int lSize;
637 
638  free(lMbcsString);
639  if (!aUtf16string) { lMbcsString = NULL; return NULL; }
640  lSize = sizeMbcs(aUtf16string);
641  if (lSize)
642  {
643  lMbcsString = (char*)malloc(lSize);
644  lSize = WideCharToMultiByte(CP_ACP, 0, aUtf16string, -1, lMbcsString, lSize, NULL, NULL);
645  }
646  else strcpy(lMbcsString, "");
647  return lMbcsString;
648 }
649 
650 
651 char * tinyfd_utf8toMbcs(char const * aUtf8string)
652 {
653  wchar_t const * lUtf16string;
654  lUtf16string = tinyfd_utf8to16(aUtf8string);
655  return tinyfd_utf16toMbcs(lUtf16string);
656 }
657 
658 
659 char * tinyfd_utf16to8(wchar_t const * aUtf16string)
660 {
661  static char * lUtf8string = NULL;
662  int lSize;
663 
664  free(lUtf8string);
665  if (!aUtf16string) { lUtf8string = NULL; return NULL; }
666  lSize = sizeUtf8(aUtf16string);
667  if (lSize)
668  {
669  lUtf8string = (char*)malloc(lSize);
670  lSize = WideCharToMultiByte(CP_UTF8, WC_ERR_INVALID_CHARS, aUtf16string, -1, lUtf8string, lSize, NULL, NULL);
671  }
672  else strcpy(lUtf8string, "");
673  return lUtf8string;
674 }
675 
676 
677 char * tinyfd_mbcsTo8(char const * aMbcsString)
678 {
679  wchar_t const * lUtf16string;
680  lUtf16string = tinyfd_mbcsTo16(aMbcsString);
681  return tinyfd_utf16to8(lUtf16string);
682 }
683 
684 
685 void tinyfd_beep(void)
686 {
687  if (windowsVersion() > 5) Beep(440, 300);
688  else MessageBeep(-1);
689 }
690 
691 
692 static void wipefileW(wchar_t const * aFilename)
693 {
694  int i;
695  FILE * lIn;
696 #if defined(__MINGW32_MAJOR_VERSION) && !defined(__MINGW64__) && (__MINGW32_MAJOR_VERSION <= 3)
697  struct _stat st;
698  if (_wstat(aFilename, &st) == 0)
699 #else
700  struct __stat64 st;
701  if (_wstat64(aFilename, &st) == 0)
702 #endif
703  {
704  if ((lIn = _wfopen(aFilename, L"w")))
705  {
706  for (i = 0; i < st.st_size; i++)
707  {
708  fputc('A', lIn);
709  }
710  fclose(lIn);
711  }
712  }
713 }
714 
715 
716 static wchar_t * getPathWithoutFinalSlashW(
717  wchar_t * aoDestination, /* make sure it is allocated, use _MAX_PATH */
718  wchar_t const * aSource) /* aoDestination and aSource can be the same */
719 {
720  wchar_t const * lTmp;
721  if (aSource)
722  {
723  lTmp = wcsrchr(aSource, L'/');
724  if (!lTmp)
725  {
726  lTmp = wcsrchr(aSource, L'\\');
727  }
728  if (lTmp)
729  {
730  wcsncpy(aoDestination, aSource, lTmp - aSource);
731  aoDestination[lTmp - aSource] = L'\0';
732  }
733  else
734  {
735  *aoDestination = L'\0';
736  }
737  }
738  else
739  {
740  *aoDestination = L'\0';
741  }
742  return aoDestination;
743 }
744 
745 
746 static wchar_t * getLastNameW(
747  wchar_t * aoDestination, /* make sure it is allocated */
748  wchar_t const * aSource)
749 {
750  /* copy the last name after '/' or '\' */
751  wchar_t const * lTmp;
752  if (aSource)
753  {
754  lTmp = wcsrchr(aSource, L'/');
755  if (!lTmp)
756  {
757  lTmp = wcsrchr(aSource, L'\\');
758  }
759  if (lTmp)
760  {
761  wcscpy(aoDestination, lTmp + 1);
762  }
763  else
764  {
765  wcscpy(aoDestination, aSource);
766  }
767  }
768  else
769  {
770  *aoDestination = L'\0';
771  }
772  return aoDestination;
773 }
774 
775 
776 static void Hex2RGBW(wchar_t const aHexRGB[8], unsigned char aoResultRGB[3])
777 {
778  wchar_t lColorChannel[8];
779  if (aoResultRGB)
780  {
781  if (aHexRGB)
782  {
783  wcscpy(lColorChannel, aHexRGB);
784  aoResultRGB[2] = (unsigned char)wcstoul(lColorChannel + 5, NULL, 16);
785  lColorChannel[5] = '\0';
786  aoResultRGB[1] = (unsigned char)wcstoul(lColorChannel + 3, NULL, 16);
787  lColorChannel[3] = '\0';
788  aoResultRGB[0] = (unsigned char)wcstoul(lColorChannel + 1, NULL, 16);
789  /* printf("%d %d %d\n", aoResultRGB[0], aoResultRGB[1], aoResultRGB[2]); */
790  }
791  else
792  {
793  aoResultRGB[0] = 0;
794  aoResultRGB[1] = 0;
795  aoResultRGB[2] = 0;
796  }
797  }
798 }
799 
800 
801 static void RGB2HexW( unsigned char const aRGB[3], wchar_t aoResultHexRGB[8])
802 {
803 #if (defined(__cplusplus ) && __cplusplus >= 201103L) || (defined(__STDC_VERSION__) && __STDC_VERSION__ >= 199901L) || defined(__clang__)
804  wchar_t const * const lPrintFormat = L"#%02hhx%02hhx%02hhx";
805 #else
806  wchar_t const * const lPrintFormat = L"#%02hx%02hx%02hx";
807 #endif
808 
809  if (aoResultHexRGB)
810  {
811  if (aRGB)
812  {
813  /* wprintf(L"aoResultHexRGB %s\n", aoResultHexRGB); */
814 #if !defined(__BORLANDC__) && !defined(__TINYC__) && !(defined(__MINGW32__) && !defined(__MINGW64_VERSION_MAJOR))
815  swprintf(aoResultHexRGB, 8, lPrintFormat, aRGB[0], aRGB[1], aRGB[2]);
816 #else
817  swprintf(aoResultHexRGB, lPrintFormat, aRGB[0], aRGB[1], aRGB[2]);
818 #endif
819 
820  }
821  else
822  {
823  aoResultHexRGB[0] = 0;
824  aoResultHexRGB[1] = 0;
825  aoResultHexRGB[2] = 0;
826  }
827  }
828 }
829 
830 
831 static int dirExists(char const * aDirPath)
832 {
833 #if defined(__MINGW32_MAJOR_VERSION) && !defined(__MINGW64__) && (__MINGW32_MAJOR_VERSION <= 3)
834  struct _stat lInfo;
835 #else
836  struct __stat64 lInfo;
837 #endif
838  wchar_t * lTmpWChar;
839  int lStatRet;
840  size_t lDirLen;
841 
842  if (!aDirPath)
843  return 0;
844  lDirLen = strlen(aDirPath);
845  if (!lDirLen)
846  return 1;
847  if ( (lDirLen == 2) && (aDirPath[1] == ':') )
848  return 1;
849 
850  if (tinyfd_winUtf8)
851  {
852  lTmpWChar = tinyfd_utf8to16(aDirPath);
853 #if defined(__MINGW32_MAJOR_VERSION) && !defined(__MINGW64__) && (__MINGW32_MAJOR_VERSION <= 3)
854  lStatRet = _wstat(lTmpWChar, &lInfo);
855 #else
856  lStatRet = _wstat64(lTmpWChar, &lInfo);
857 #endif
858  if (lStatRet != 0)
859  return 0;
860  else if (lInfo.st_mode & S_IFDIR)
861  return 1;
862  else
863  return 0;
864  }
865 #if defined(__MINGW32_MAJOR_VERSION) && !defined(__MINGW64__) && (__MINGW32_MAJOR_VERSION <= 3)
866  else if (_stat(aDirPath, &lInfo) != 0)
867 #else
868  else if (_stat64(aDirPath, &lInfo) != 0)
869 #endif
870  return 0;
871  else if (lInfo.st_mode & S_IFDIR)
872  return 1;
873  else
874  return 0;
875 }
876 
877 
878 static int fileExists(char const * aFilePathAndName)
879 {
880 #if defined(__MINGW32_MAJOR_VERSION) && !defined(__MINGW64__) && (__MINGW32_MAJOR_VERSION <= 3)
881  struct _stat lInfo;
882 #else
883  struct __stat64 lInfo;
884 #endif
885  wchar_t * lTmpWChar;
886  int lStatRet;
887  FILE * lIn;
888 
889  if (!aFilePathAndName || !strlen(aFilePathAndName))
890  {
891  return 0;
892  }
893 
894  if (tinyfd_winUtf8)
895  {
896  lTmpWChar = tinyfd_utf8to16(aFilePathAndName);
897 #if defined(__MINGW32_MAJOR_VERSION) && !defined(__MINGW64__) && (__MINGW32_MAJOR_VERSION <= 3)
898  lStatRet = _wstat(lTmpWChar, &lInfo);
899 #else
900  lStatRet = _wstat64(lTmpWChar, &lInfo);
901 #endif
902 
903  if (lStatRet != 0)
904  return 0;
905  else if (lInfo.st_mode & _S_IFREG)
906  return 1;
907  else
908  return 0;
909  }
910  else
911  {
912  lIn = fopen(aFilePathAndName, "r");
913  if (!lIn)
914  {
915  return 0;
916  }
917  fclose(lIn);
918  return 1;
919  }
920 }
921 
922 static void replaceWchar(wchar_t * aString,
923  wchar_t aOldChr,
924  wchar_t aNewChr)
925 {
926  wchar_t * p;
927 
928  if (!aString)
929  {
930  return ;
931  }
932 
933  if (aOldChr == aNewChr)
934  {
935  return ;
936  }
937 
938  p = aString;
939  while ((p = wcsrchr(p, aOldChr)))
940  {
941  *p = aNewChr;
942 #ifdef TINYFD_NOCCSUNICODE
943  p++;
944 #endif
945  p++;
946  }
947  return ;
948 }
949 
950 
951 static int quoteDetectedW(wchar_t const * aString)
952 {
953  wchar_t const * p;
954 
955  if (!aString) return 0;
956 
957  p = aString;
958  while ((p = wcsrchr(p, L'\'')))
959  {
960  return 1;
961  }
962 
963  p = aString;
964  while ((p = wcsrchr(p, L'\"')))
965  {
966  return 1;
967  }
968 
969  return 0;
970 }
971 
972 #endif /* _WIN32 */
973 
974 /* source and destination can be the same or ovelap*/
975 static char * ensureFilesExist(char * aDestination,
976  char const * aSourcePathsAndNames)
977 {
978  char * lDestination = aDestination;
979  char const * p;
980  char const * p2;
981  size_t lLen;
982 
983  if (!aSourcePathsAndNames)
984  {
985  return NULL;
986  }
987  lLen = strlen(aSourcePathsAndNames);
988  if (!lLen)
989  {
990  return NULL;
991  }
992 
993  p = aSourcePathsAndNames;
994  while ((p2 = strchr(p, '|')) != NULL)
995  {
996  lLen = p2 - p;
997  memmove(lDestination, p, lLen);
998  lDestination[lLen] = '\0';
999  if (fileExists(lDestination))
1000  {
1001  lDestination += lLen;
1002  *lDestination = '|';
1003  lDestination++;
1004  }
1005  p = p2 + 1;
1006  }
1007  if (fileExists(p))
1008  {
1009  lLen = strlen(p);
1010  memmove(lDestination, p, lLen);
1011  lDestination[lLen] = '\0';
1012  }
1013  else
1014  {
1015  *(lDestination - 1) = '\0';
1016  }
1017  return aDestination;
1018 }
1019 
1020 #ifdef _WIN32
1021 
1022 static int __stdcall EnumThreadWndProc(HWND hwnd, LPARAM lParam)
1023 {
1024  wchar_t lTitleName[MAX_PATH];
1025  GetWindowTextW(hwnd, lTitleName, MAX_PATH);
1026  /* wprintf(L"lTitleName %ls \n", lTitleName); */
1027  if (wcscmp(L"tinyfiledialogsTopWindow", lTitleName) == 0)
1028  {
1029  SetWindowPos(hwnd, HWND_TOPMOST, 0, 0, 0, 0, SWP_NOMOVE | SWP_NOSIZE);
1030  return 0;
1031  }
1032  return 1;
1033 }
1034 
1035 
1036 static void hiddenConsoleW(wchar_t const * aString, wchar_t const * aDialogTitle, int aInFront)
1037 {
1038  STARTUPINFOW StartupInfo;
1039  PROCESS_INFORMATION ProcessInfo;
1040 
1041  if (!aString || !wcslen(aString) ) return;
1042 
1043  memset(&StartupInfo, 0, sizeof(StartupInfo));
1044  StartupInfo.cb = sizeof(STARTUPINFOW);
1045  StartupInfo.dwFlags = STARTF_USESHOWWINDOW;
1046  StartupInfo.wShowWindow = SW_HIDE;
1047 
1048  if (!CreateProcessW(NULL, (LPWSTR)aString, NULL, NULL, FALSE,
1049  CREATE_NEW_CONSOLE, NULL, NULL,
1050  &StartupInfo, &ProcessInfo))
1051  {
1052  return; /* GetLastError(); */
1053  }
1054 
1055  WaitForInputIdle(ProcessInfo.hProcess, INFINITE);
1056  if (aInFront)
1057  {
1058  while (EnumWindows(EnumThreadWndProc, (LPARAM)NULL)) {}
1059  SetWindowTextW(GetForegroundWindow(), aDialogTitle);
1060  }
1061  WaitForSingleObject(ProcessInfo.hProcess, INFINITE);
1062  CloseHandle(ProcessInfo.hThread);
1063  CloseHandle(ProcessInfo.hProcess);
1064 }
1065 
1066 
1067 int tinyfd_messageBoxW(
1068  wchar_t const * aTitle, /* NULL or "" */
1069  wchar_t const * aMessage, /* NULL or "" may contain \n and \t */
1070  wchar_t const * aDialogType, /* "ok" "okcancel" "yesno" "yesnocancel" */
1071  wchar_t const * aIconType, /* "info" "warning" "error" "question" */
1072  int aDefaultButton) /* 0 for cancel/no , 1 for ok/yes , 2 for no in yesnocancel */
1073 {
1074  int lBoxReturnValue;
1075  UINT aCode;
1076 
1077  if (aTitle&&!wcscmp(aTitle, L"tinyfd_query")){ strcpy(tinyfd_response, "windows_wchar"); return 1; }
1078 
1079  if (quoteDetectedW(aTitle)) return tinyfd_messageBoxW(L"INVALID TITLE WITH QUOTES", aMessage, aDialogType, aIconType, aDefaultButton);
1080  if (quoteDetectedW(aMessage)) return tinyfd_messageBoxW(aTitle, L"INVALID MESSAGE WITH QUOTES", aDialogType, aIconType, aDefaultButton);
1081 
1082  if (aIconType && !wcscmp(L"warning", aIconType))
1083  {
1084  aCode = MB_ICONWARNING;
1085  }
1086  else if (aIconType && !wcscmp(L"error", aIconType))
1087  {
1088  aCode = MB_ICONERROR;
1089  }
1090  else if (aIconType && !wcscmp(L"question", aIconType))
1091  {
1092  aCode = MB_ICONQUESTION;
1093  }
1094  else
1095  {
1096  aCode = MB_ICONINFORMATION;
1097  }
1098 
1099  if (aDialogType && !wcscmp(L"okcancel", aDialogType))
1100  {
1101  aCode += MB_OKCANCEL;
1102  if (!aDefaultButton)
1103  {
1104  aCode += MB_DEFBUTTON2;
1105  }
1106  }
1107  else if (aDialogType && !wcscmp(L"yesno", aDialogType))
1108  {
1109  aCode += MB_YESNO;
1110  if (!aDefaultButton)
1111  {
1112  aCode += MB_DEFBUTTON2;
1113  }
1114  }
1115  else
1116  {
1117  aCode += MB_OK;
1118  }
1119 
1120  aCode += MB_TOPMOST;
1121 
1122  lBoxReturnValue = MessageBoxW(GetForegroundWindow(), aMessage, aTitle, aCode);
1123  if (((aDialogType
1124  && wcscmp(L"okcancel", aDialogType)
1125  && wcscmp(L"yesno", aDialogType)))
1126  || (lBoxReturnValue == IDOK)
1127  || (lBoxReturnValue == IDYES))
1128  {
1129  return 1;
1130  }
1131  else
1132  {
1133  return 0;
1134  }
1135 }
1136 
1137 
1138 /* return has only meaning for tinyfd_query */
1139 int tinyfd_notifyPopupW(
1140  wchar_t const * aTitle, /* NULL or L"" */
1141  wchar_t const * aMessage, /* NULL or L"" may contain \n \t */
1142  wchar_t const * aIconType) /* L"info" L"warning" L"error" */
1143 {
1144  wchar_t * lDialogString;
1145  size_t lTitleLen;
1146  size_t lMessageLen;
1147  size_t lDialogStringLen;
1148 
1149  if (aTitle && !wcscmp(aTitle, L"tinyfd_query")) { strcpy(tinyfd_response, "windows_wchar"); return 1; }
1150 
1151  if (quoteDetectedW(aTitle)) return tinyfd_notifyPopupW(L"INVALID TITLE WITH QUOTES", aMessage, aIconType);
1152  if (quoteDetectedW(aMessage)) return tinyfd_notifyPopupW(aTitle, L"INVALID MESSAGE WITH QUOTES", aIconType);
1153 
1154  lTitleLen = aTitle ? wcslen(aTitle) : 0;
1155  lMessageLen = aMessage ? wcslen(aMessage) : 0;
1156  lDialogStringLen = 3 * MAX_PATH_OR_CMD + lTitleLen + lMessageLen;
1157  lDialogString = (wchar_t *)malloc(2 * lDialogStringLen);
1158  if (!lDialogString) return 0;
1159 
1160  wcscpy(lDialogString, L"powershell.exe -command \"\
1161 function Show-BalloonTip {\
1162 [cmdletbinding()] \
1163 param( \
1164 [string]$Title = ' ', \
1165 [string]$Message = ' ', \
1166 [ValidateSet('info', 'warning', 'error')] \
1167 [string]$IconType = 'info');\
1168 [system.Reflection.Assembly]::LoadWithPartialName('System.Windows.Forms') | Out-Null ; \
1169 $balloon = New-Object System.Windows.Forms.NotifyIcon ; \
1170 $path = Get-Process -id $pid | Select-Object -ExpandProperty Path ; \
1171 $icon = [System.Drawing.Icon]::ExtractAssociatedIcon($path) ;");
1172 
1173  wcscat(lDialogString, L"\
1174 $balloon.Icon = $icon ; \
1175 $balloon.BalloonTipIcon = $IconType ; \
1176 $balloon.BalloonTipText = $Message ; \
1177 $balloon.BalloonTipTitle = $Title ; \
1178 $balloon.Text = 'tinyfiledialogs' ; \
1179 $balloon.Visible = $true ; \
1180 $balloon.ShowBalloonTip(5000)};\
1181 Show-BalloonTip");
1182 
1183  if (aTitle && wcslen(aTitle))
1184  {
1185  wcscat(lDialogString, L" -Title '");
1186  wcscat(lDialogString, aTitle);
1187  wcscat(lDialogString, L"'");
1188  }
1189  if (aMessage && wcslen(aMessage))
1190  {
1191  wcscat(lDialogString, L" -Message '");
1192  wcscat(lDialogString, aMessage);
1193  wcscat(lDialogString, L"'");
1194  }
1195  if (aMessage && wcslen(aIconType))
1196  {
1197  wcscat(lDialogString, L" -IconType '");
1198  wcscat(lDialogString, aIconType);
1199  wcscat(lDialogString, L"'");
1200  }
1201  wcscat(lDialogString, L"\"");
1202 
1203  /* wprintf ( L"lDialogString: %ls\n" , lDialogString ) ; */
1204 
1205  hiddenConsoleW(lDialogString, aTitle, 0);
1206  free(lDialogString);
1207  return 1;
1208 }
1209 
1210 
1211 wchar_t * tinyfd_inputBoxW(
1212  wchar_t const * aTitle, /* NULL or L"" */
1213  wchar_t const * aMessage, /* NULL or L"" (\n and \t have no effect) */
1214  wchar_t const * aDefaultInput) /* L"" , if NULL it's a passwordBox */
1215 {
1216  static wchar_t lBuff[MAX_PATH_OR_CMD];
1217  wchar_t * lDialogString;
1218  FILE * lIn;
1219  FILE * lFile;
1220  int lResult;
1221  size_t lTitleLen;
1222  size_t lMessageLen;
1223  size_t lDialogStringLen;
1224 
1225  if (aTitle&&!wcscmp(aTitle, L"tinyfd_query")){ strcpy(tinyfd_response, "windows_wchar"); return (wchar_t *)1; }
1226 
1227  if (quoteDetectedW(aTitle)) return tinyfd_inputBoxW(L"INVALID TITLE WITH QUOTES", aMessage, aDefaultInput);
1228  if (quoteDetectedW(aMessage)) return tinyfd_inputBoxW(aTitle, L"INVALID MESSAGE WITH QUOTES", aDefaultInput);
1229  if (quoteDetectedW(aDefaultInput)) return tinyfd_inputBoxW(aTitle, aMessage, L"INVALID DEFAULT_INPUT WITH QUOTES");
1230 
1231  lTitleLen = aTitle ? wcslen(aTitle) : 0 ;
1232  lMessageLen = aMessage ? wcslen(aMessage) : 0 ;
1233  lDialogStringLen = 3 * MAX_PATH_OR_CMD + lTitleLen + lMessageLen;
1234  lDialogString = (wchar_t *)malloc(2 * lDialogStringLen);
1235 
1236  if (aDefaultInput)
1237  {
1238  swprintf(lDialogString,
1239 #if !defined(__BORLANDC__) && !defined(__TINYC__) && !(defined(__MINGW32__) && !defined(__MINGW64_VERSION_MAJOR))
1240  lDialogStringLen,
1241 #endif
1242  L"%ls\\tinyfd.vbs", _wgetenv(L"TEMP"));
1243  }
1244  else
1245  {
1246  swprintf(lDialogString,
1247 #if !defined(__BORLANDC__) && !defined(__TINYC__) && !(defined(__MINGW32__) && !defined(__MINGW64_VERSION_MAJOR))
1248  lDialogStringLen,
1249 #endif
1250  L"%ls\\tinyfd.hta", _wgetenv(L"TEMP"));
1251  }
1252  lIn = _wfopen(lDialogString, L"w");
1253  if (!lIn)
1254  {
1255  free(lDialogString);
1256  return NULL;
1257  }
1258 
1259  if ( aDefaultInput )
1260  {
1261  wcscpy(lDialogString, L"Dim result:result=InputBox(\"");
1262  if (aMessage && wcslen(aMessage))
1263  {
1264  wcscpy(lBuff, aMessage);
1265  replaceWchar(lBuff, L'\n', L' ');
1266  wcscat(lDialogString, lBuff);
1267  }
1268  wcscat(lDialogString, L"\",\"tinyfiledialogsTopWindow\",\"");
1269  if (aDefaultInput && wcslen(aDefaultInput))
1270  {
1271  wcscpy(lBuff, aDefaultInput);
1272  replaceWchar(lBuff, L'\n', L' ');
1273  wcscat(lDialogString, lBuff);
1274  }
1275  wcscat(lDialogString, L"\"):If IsEmpty(result) then:WScript.Echo 0");
1276  wcscat(lDialogString, L":Else: WScript.Echo \"1\" & result : End If");
1277  }
1278  else
1279  {
1280  wcscpy(lDialogString, L"\n\
1281 <html>\n\
1282 <head>\n\
1283 <title>");
1284 
1285  wcscat(lDialogString, L"tinyfiledialogsTopWindow");
1286  wcscat(lDialogString, L"</title>\n\
1287 <HTA:APPLICATION\n\
1288 ID = 'tinyfdHTA'\n\
1289 APPLICATIONNAME = 'tinyfd_inputBox'\n\
1290 MINIMIZEBUTTON = 'no'\n\
1291 MAXIMIZEBUTTON = 'no'\n\
1292 BORDER = 'dialog'\n\
1293 SCROLL = 'no'\n\
1294 SINGLEINSTANCE = 'yes'\n\
1295 WINDOWSTATE = 'hidden'>\n\
1296 \n\
1297 <script language = 'VBScript'>\n\
1298 \n\
1299 intWidth = Screen.Width/4\n\
1300 intHeight = Screen.Height/6\n\
1301 ResizeTo intWidth, intHeight\n\
1302 MoveTo((Screen.Width/2)-(intWidth/2)),((Screen.Height/2)-(intHeight/2))\n\
1303 result = 0\n\
1304 \n\
1305 Sub Window_onLoad\n\
1306 txt_input.Focus\n\
1307 End Sub\n\
1308 \n");
1309 
1310  wcscat(lDialogString, L"\
1311 Sub Window_onUnload\n\
1312 Set objFSO = CreateObject(\"Scripting.FileSystemObject\")\n\
1313 Set oShell = CreateObject(\"WScript.Shell\")\n\
1314 strTempFolder = oShell.ExpandEnvironmentStrings(\"%TEMP%\")\n\
1315 Set objFile = objFSO.CreateTextFile(strTempFolder & \"\\tinyfd.txt\",True,True)\n\
1316 If result = 1 Then\n\
1317 objFile.Write 1 & txt_input.Value\n\
1318 Else\n\
1319 objFile.Write 0\n\
1320 End If\n\
1321 objFile.Close\n\
1322 End Sub\n\
1323 \n\
1324 Sub Run_ProgramOK\n\
1325 result = 1\n\
1326 window.Close\n\
1327 End Sub\n\
1328 \n\
1329 Sub Run_ProgramCancel\n\
1330 window.Close\n\
1331 End Sub\n\
1332 \n");
1333 
1334  wcscat(lDialogString, L"Sub Default_Buttons\n\
1335 If Window.Event.KeyCode = 13 Then\n\
1336 btn_OK.Click\n\
1337 ElseIf Window.Event.KeyCode = 27 Then\n\
1338 btn_Cancel.Click\n\
1339 End If\n\
1340 End Sub\n\
1341 \n\
1342 </script>\n\
1343 </head>\n\
1344 <body style = 'background-color:#EEEEEE' onkeypress = 'vbs:Default_Buttons' align = 'top'>\n\
1345 <table width = '100%' height = '80%' align = 'center' border = '0'>\n\
1346 <tr border = '0'>\n\
1347 <td align = 'left' valign = 'middle' style='Font-Family:Arial'>\n");
1348 
1349  wcscat(lDialogString, aMessage ? aMessage : L"");
1350 
1351  wcscat(lDialogString, L"\n\
1352 </td>\n\
1353 <td align = 'right' valign = 'middle' style = 'margin-top: 0em'>\n\
1354 <table align = 'right' style = 'margin-right: 0em;'>\n\
1355 <tr align = 'right' style = 'margin-top: 5em;'>\n\
1356 <input type = 'button' value = 'OK' name = 'btn_OK' onClick = 'vbs:Run_ProgramOK' style = 'width: 5em; margin-top: 2em;'><br>\n\
1357 <input type = 'button' value = 'Cancel' name = 'btn_Cancel' onClick = 'vbs:Run_ProgramCancel' style = 'width: 5em;'><br><br>\n\
1358 </tr>\n\
1359 </table>\n\
1360 </td>\n\
1361 </tr>\n\
1362 </table>\n");
1363 
1364  wcscat(lDialogString, L"<table width = '100%' height = '100%' align = 'center' border = '0'>\n\
1365 <tr>\n\
1366 <td align = 'left' valign = 'top'>\n\
1367 <input type = 'password' id = 'txt_input'\n\
1368 name = 'txt_input' value = '' style = 'float:left;width:100%' ><BR>\n\
1369 </td>\n\
1370 </tr>\n\
1371 </table>\n\
1372 </body>\n\
1373 </html>\n\
1374 " ) ;
1375  }
1376  fputws(lDialogString, lIn);
1377  fclose(lIn);
1378 
1379  if (aDefaultInput)
1380  {
1381  swprintf(lDialogString,
1382 #if !defined(__BORLANDC__) && !defined(__TINYC__) && !(defined(__MINGW32__) && !defined(__MINGW64_VERSION_MAJOR))
1383  lDialogStringLen,
1384 #endif
1385  L"%ls\\tinyfd.txt",_wgetenv(L"TEMP"));
1386 
1387 #ifdef TINYFD_NOCCSUNICODE
1388  lFile = _wfopen(lDialogString, L"w");
1389  fputc(0xFF, lFile);
1390  fputc(0xFE, lFile);
1391 #else
1392  lFile = _wfopen(lDialogString, L"wt, ccs=UNICODE"); /*or ccs=UTF-16LE*/
1393 #endif
1394  fclose(lFile);
1395 
1396  wcscpy(lDialogString, L"cmd.exe /c cscript.exe //U //Nologo ");
1397  wcscat(lDialogString, L"\"%TEMP%\\tinyfd.vbs\" ");
1398  wcscat(lDialogString, L">> \"%TEMP%\\tinyfd.txt\"");
1399  }
1400  else
1401  {
1402  wcscpy(lDialogString,
1403  L"cmd.exe /c mshta.exe \"%TEMP%\\tinyfd.hta\"");
1404  }
1405 
1406  /* wprintf ( "lDialogString: %ls\n" , lDialogString ) ; */
1407 
1408  hiddenConsoleW(lDialogString, aTitle, 1);
1409 
1410  swprintf(lDialogString,
1411 #if !defined(__BORLANDC__) && !defined(__TINYC__) && !(defined(__MINGW32__) && !defined(__MINGW64_VERSION_MAJOR))
1412  lDialogStringLen,
1413 #endif
1414  L"%ls\\tinyfd.txt", _wgetenv(L"TEMP"));
1415  /* wprintf(L"lDialogString: %ls\n", lDialogString); */
1416 #ifdef TINYFD_NOCCSUNICODE
1417  if (!(lIn = _wfopen(lDialogString, L"r")))
1418 #else
1419  if (!(lIn = _wfopen(lDialogString, L"rt, ccs=UNICODE"))) /*or ccs=UTF-16LE*/
1420 #endif
1421  {
1422  _wremove(lDialogString);
1423  free(lDialogString);
1424  return NULL;
1425  }
1426 
1427  memset(lBuff, 0, MAX_PATH_OR_CMD * sizeof(wchar_t) );
1428 
1429 #ifdef TINYFD_NOCCSUNICODE
1430  fgets((char *)lBuff, 2*MAX_PATH_OR_CMD, lIn);
1431 #else
1432  fgetws(lBuff, MAX_PATH_OR_CMD, lIn);
1433 #endif
1434  fclose(lIn);
1435  wipefileW(lDialogString);
1436  _wremove(lDialogString);
1437 
1438  if (aDefaultInput)
1439  {
1440  swprintf(lDialogString,
1441 #if !defined(__BORLANDC__) && !defined(__TINYC__) && !(defined(__MINGW32__) && !defined(__MINGW64_VERSION_MAJOR))
1442  lDialogStringLen,
1443 #endif
1444  L"%ls\\tinyfd.vbs", _wgetenv(L"TEMP"));
1445  }
1446  else
1447  {
1448  swprintf(lDialogString,
1449 #if !defined(__BORLANDC__) && !defined(__TINYC__) && !(defined(__MINGW32__) && !defined(__MINGW64_VERSION_MAJOR))
1450  lDialogStringLen,
1451 #endif
1452  L"%ls\\tinyfd.hta", _wgetenv(L"TEMP"));
1453  }
1454  _wremove(lDialogString);
1455  free(lDialogString);
1456  /* wprintf( L"lBuff: %ls\n" , lBuff ) ; */
1457 #ifdef TINYFD_NOCCSUNICODE
1458  lResult = !wcsncmp(lBuff+1, L"1", 1);
1459 #else
1460  lResult = !wcsncmp(lBuff, L"1", 1);
1461 #endif
1462 
1463  /* printf( "lResult: %d \n" , lResult ) ; */
1464  if (!lResult)
1465  {
1466  return NULL ;
1467  }
1468 
1469  /* wprintf( "lBuff+1: %ls\n" , lBuff+1 ) ; */
1470 
1471 #ifdef TINYFD_NOCCSUNICODE
1472  if (aDefaultInput)
1473  {
1474  lDialogStringLen = wcslen(lBuff) ;
1475  lBuff[lDialogStringLen - 1] = L'\0';
1476  lBuff[lDialogStringLen - 2] = L'\0';
1477  }
1478  return lBuff + 2;
1479 #else
1480  if (aDefaultInput) lBuff[wcslen(lBuff) - 1] = L'\0';
1481  return lBuff + 1;
1482 #endif
1483 }
1484 
1485 
1486 wchar_t * tinyfd_saveFileDialogW(
1487  wchar_t const * aTitle, /* NULL or "" */
1488  wchar_t const * aDefaultPathAndFile, /* NULL or "" */
1489  int aNumOfFilterPatterns, /* 0 */
1490  wchar_t const * const * aFilterPatterns, /* NULL or {"*.jpg","*.png"} */
1491  wchar_t const * aSingleFilterDescription) /* NULL or "image files" */
1492 {
1493  static wchar_t lBuff[MAX_PATH_OR_CMD];
1494  wchar_t lDirname[MAX_PATH_OR_CMD];
1495  wchar_t lDialogString[MAX_PATH_OR_CMD];
1496  wchar_t lFilterPatterns[MAX_PATH_OR_CMD] = L"";
1497  wchar_t * p;
1498  wchar_t * lRetval;
1499  wchar_t const * ldefExt = NULL;
1500  int i;
1501  HRESULT lHResult;
1502  OPENFILENAMEW ofn = {0};
1503 
1504  if (aTitle&&!wcscmp(aTitle, L"tinyfd_query")){ strcpy(tinyfd_response, "windows_wchar"); return (wchar_t *)1; }
1505 
1506  if (quoteDetectedW(aTitle)) return tinyfd_saveFileDialogW(L"INVALID TITLE WITH QUOTES", aDefaultPathAndFile, aNumOfFilterPatterns, aFilterPatterns, aSingleFilterDescription);
1507  if (quoteDetectedW(aDefaultPathAndFile)) return tinyfd_saveFileDialogW(aTitle, L"INVALID DEFAULT_PATH WITH QUOTES", aNumOfFilterPatterns, aFilterPatterns, aSingleFilterDescription);
1508  if (quoteDetectedW(aSingleFilterDescription)) return tinyfd_saveFileDialogW(aTitle, aDefaultPathAndFile, aNumOfFilterPatterns, aFilterPatterns, L"INVALID FILTER_DESCRIPTION WITH QUOTES");
1509  for (i = 0; i < aNumOfFilterPatterns; i++)
1510  {
1511  if (quoteDetectedW(aFilterPatterns[i])) return tinyfd_saveFileDialogW(L"INVALID FILTER_PATTERN WITH QUOTES", aDefaultPathAndFile, 0, NULL, NULL);
1512  }
1513 
1514  lHResult = CoInitializeEx(NULL, 0);
1515 
1516  getPathWithoutFinalSlashW(lDirname, aDefaultPathAndFile);
1517  getLastNameW(lBuff, aDefaultPathAndFile);
1518 
1519  if (aNumOfFilterPatterns > 0)
1520  {
1521  ldefExt = aFilterPatterns[0];
1522 
1523  if (aSingleFilterDescription && wcslen(aSingleFilterDescription))
1524  {
1525  wcscpy(lFilterPatterns, aSingleFilterDescription);
1526  wcscat(lFilterPatterns, L"\n");
1527  }
1528  wcscat(lFilterPatterns, aFilterPatterns[0]);
1529  for (i = 1; i < aNumOfFilterPatterns; i++)
1530  {
1531  wcscat(lFilterPatterns, L";");
1532  wcscat(lFilterPatterns, aFilterPatterns[i]);
1533  }
1534  wcscat(lFilterPatterns, L"\n");
1535  if (!(aSingleFilterDescription && wcslen(aSingleFilterDescription)))
1536  {
1537  wcscpy(lDialogString, lFilterPatterns);
1538  wcscat(lFilterPatterns, lDialogString);
1539  }
1540  wcscat(lFilterPatterns, L"All Files\n*.*\n");
1541  p = lFilterPatterns;
1542  while ((p = wcschr(p, L'\n')) != NULL)
1543  {
1544  *p = L'\0';
1545  p++;
1546  }
1547  }
1548 
1549  ofn.lStructSize = sizeof(OPENFILENAMEW);
1550  ofn.hwndOwner = GetForegroundWindow();
1551  ofn.hInstance = 0;
1552  ofn.lpstrFilter = wcslen(lFilterPatterns) ? lFilterPatterns : NULL;
1553  ofn.lpstrCustomFilter = NULL;
1554  ofn.nMaxCustFilter = 0;
1555  ofn.nFilterIndex = 1;
1556  ofn.lpstrFile = lBuff;
1557 
1558  ofn.nMaxFile = MAX_PATH_OR_CMD;
1559  ofn.lpstrFileTitle = NULL;
1560  ofn.nMaxFileTitle = MAX_PATH_OR_CMD/2;
1561  ofn.lpstrInitialDir = wcslen(lDirname) ? lDirname : NULL;
1562  ofn.lpstrTitle = aTitle && wcslen(aTitle) ? aTitle : NULL;
1563  ofn.Flags = OFN_OVERWRITEPROMPT | OFN_NOCHANGEDIR | OFN_PATHMUSTEXIST ;
1564  ofn.nFileOffset = 0;
1565  ofn.nFileExtension = 0;
1566  ofn.lpstrDefExt = ldefExt;
1567  ofn.lCustData = 0L;
1568  ofn.lpfnHook = NULL;
1569  ofn.lpTemplateName = NULL;
1570 
1571  if (GetSaveFileNameW(&ofn) == 0)
1572  {
1573  lRetval = NULL;
1574  }
1575  else
1576  {
1577  lRetval = lBuff;
1578  }
1579 
1580  if (lHResult == S_OK || lHResult == S_FALSE)
1581  {
1582  CoUninitialize();
1583  }
1584  return lRetval;
1585 }
1586 
1587 
1588 wchar_t * tinyfd_openFileDialogW(
1589  wchar_t const * aTitle, /* NULL or "" */
1590  wchar_t const * aDefaultPathAndFile, /* NULL or "" */
1591  int aNumOfFilterPatterns, /* 0 */
1592  wchar_t const * const * aFilterPatterns, /* NULL or {"*.jpg","*.png"} */
1593  wchar_t const * aSingleFilterDescription, /* NULL or "image files" */
1594  int aAllowMultipleSelects) /* 0 or 1 ; -1 to free allocated memory and return */
1595 {
1596  size_t lLengths[MAX_MULTIPLE_FILES];
1597  wchar_t lDirname[MAX_PATH_OR_CMD];
1598  wchar_t lFilterPatterns[MAX_PATH_OR_CMD] = L"";
1599  wchar_t lDialogString[MAX_PATH_OR_CMD];
1600  wchar_t * lPointers[MAX_MULTIPLE_FILES+1];
1601  wchar_t * p;
1602  int i, j;
1603  size_t lBuffLen;
1604  DWORD lFullBuffLen;
1605  HRESULT lHResult;
1606  OPENFILENAMEW ofn = { 0 };
1607  static wchar_t * lBuff = NULL;
1608 
1609  free(lBuff);
1610  lBuff = NULL;
1611  if (aAllowMultipleSelects < 0) return (wchar_t *)0;
1612 
1613  if (aTitle&&!wcscmp(aTitle, L"tinyfd_query")){ strcpy(tinyfd_response, "windows_wchar"); return (wchar_t *)1; }
1614 
1615  if (quoteDetectedW(aTitle)) return tinyfd_openFileDialogW(L"INVALID TITLE WITH QUOTES", aDefaultPathAndFile, aNumOfFilterPatterns, aFilterPatterns, aSingleFilterDescription, aAllowMultipleSelects);
1616  if (quoteDetectedW(aDefaultPathAndFile)) return tinyfd_openFileDialogW(aTitle, L"INVALID DEFAULT_PATH WITH QUOTES", aNumOfFilterPatterns, aFilterPatterns, aSingleFilterDescription, aAllowMultipleSelects);
1617  if (quoteDetectedW(aSingleFilterDescription)) return tinyfd_openFileDialogW(aTitle, aDefaultPathAndFile, aNumOfFilterPatterns, aFilterPatterns, L"INVALID FILTER_DESCRIPTION WITH QUOTES", aAllowMultipleSelects);
1618  for (i = 0; i < aNumOfFilterPatterns; i++)
1619  {
1620  if (quoteDetectedW(aFilterPatterns[i])) return tinyfd_openFileDialogW(L"INVALID FILTER_PATTERN WITH QUOTES", aDefaultPathAndFile, 0, NULL, NULL, aAllowMultipleSelects);
1621  }
1622 
1623  if (aAllowMultipleSelects)
1624  {
1625  lFullBuffLen = MAX_MULTIPLE_FILES * MAX_PATH_OR_CMD + 1;
1626  lBuff = (wchar_t*)(malloc(lFullBuffLen * sizeof(wchar_t)));
1627  if (!lBuff)
1628  {
1629  lFullBuffLen = LOW_MULTIPLE_FILES * MAX_PATH_OR_CMD + 1;
1630  lBuff = (wchar_t*)( malloc( lFullBuffLen * sizeof(wchar_t)));
1631  }
1632  }
1633  else
1634  {
1635  lFullBuffLen = MAX_PATH_OR_CMD + 1;
1636  lBuff = (wchar_t*)(malloc(lFullBuffLen * sizeof(wchar_t)));
1637  }
1638  if (!lBuff) return NULL;
1639 
1640  lHResult = CoInitializeEx(NULL, 0);
1641 
1642  getPathWithoutFinalSlashW(lDirname, aDefaultPathAndFile);
1643  getLastNameW(lBuff, aDefaultPathAndFile);
1644 
1645  if (aNumOfFilterPatterns > 0)
1646  {
1647  if (aSingleFilterDescription && wcslen(aSingleFilterDescription))
1648  {
1649  wcscpy(lFilterPatterns, aSingleFilterDescription);
1650  wcscat(lFilterPatterns, L"\n");
1651  }
1652  wcscat(lFilterPatterns, aFilterPatterns[0]);
1653  for (i = 1; i < aNumOfFilterPatterns; i++)
1654  {
1655  wcscat(lFilterPatterns, L";");
1656  wcscat(lFilterPatterns, aFilterPatterns[i]);
1657  }
1658  wcscat(lFilterPatterns, L"\n");
1659  if (!(aSingleFilterDescription && wcslen(aSingleFilterDescription)))
1660  {
1661  wcscpy(lDialogString, lFilterPatterns);
1662  wcscat(lFilterPatterns, lDialogString);
1663  }
1664  wcscat(lFilterPatterns, L"All Files\n*.*\n");
1665  p = lFilterPatterns;
1666  while ((p = wcschr(p, L'\n')) != NULL)
1667  {
1668  *p = L'\0';
1669  p++;
1670  }
1671  }
1672 
1673  ofn.lStructSize = sizeof(OPENFILENAME);
1674  ofn.hwndOwner = GetForegroundWindow();
1675  ofn.hInstance = 0;
1676  ofn.lpstrFilter = wcslen(lFilterPatterns) ? lFilterPatterns : NULL;
1677  ofn.lpstrCustomFilter = NULL;
1678  ofn.nMaxCustFilter = 0;
1679  ofn.nFilterIndex = 1;
1680  ofn.lpstrFile = lBuff;
1681  ofn.nMaxFile = lFullBuffLen;
1682  ofn.lpstrFileTitle = NULL;
1683  ofn.nMaxFileTitle = MAX_PATH_OR_CMD / 2;
1684  ofn.lpstrInitialDir = wcslen(lDirname) ? lDirname : NULL;
1685  ofn.lpstrTitle = aTitle && wcslen(aTitle) ? aTitle : NULL;
1686  ofn.Flags = OFN_EXPLORER | OFN_NOCHANGEDIR | OFN_PATHMUSTEXIST | OFN_FILEMUSTEXIST;
1687  ofn.nFileOffset = 0;
1688  ofn.nFileExtension = 0;
1689  ofn.lpstrDefExt = NULL;
1690  ofn.lCustData = 0L;
1691  ofn.lpfnHook = NULL;
1692  ofn.lpTemplateName = NULL;
1693 
1694  if (aAllowMultipleSelects)
1695  {
1696  ofn.Flags |= OFN_ALLOWMULTISELECT;
1697  }
1698 
1699  if (GetOpenFileNameW(&ofn) == 0)
1700  {
1701  free(lBuff);
1702  lBuff = NULL;
1703  }
1704  else
1705  {
1706  lBuffLen = wcslen(lBuff);
1707  lPointers[0] = lBuff + lBuffLen + 1;
1708  if (aAllowMultipleSelects && (lPointers[0][0] != L'\0'))
1709  {
1710  i = 0;
1711  do
1712  {
1713  lLengths[i] = wcslen(lPointers[i]);
1714  lPointers[i + 1] = lPointers[i] + lLengths[i] + 1;
1715  i++;
1716  } while (lPointers[i][0] != L'\0' && i < MAX_MULTIPLE_FILES );
1717  if (i > MAX_MULTIPLE_FILES)
1718  {
1719  free(lBuff);
1720  lBuff = NULL;
1721  }
1722  else
1723  {
1724  i--;
1725  p = lBuff + lFullBuffLen - 1;
1726  *p = L'\0';
1727  for (j = i; j >= 0; j--)
1728  {
1729  p -= lLengths[j];
1730  memmove(p, lPointers[j], lLengths[j] * sizeof(wchar_t));
1731  p--;
1732  *p = L'\\';
1733  p -= lBuffLen;
1734  memmove(p, lBuff, lBuffLen*sizeof(wchar_t));
1735  p--;
1736  *p = L'|';
1737  }
1738  p++;
1739  wcscpy(lBuff, p);
1740  lBuffLen = wcslen(lBuff);
1741  }
1742  }
1743  if (lBuff) lBuff = (wchar_t*)(realloc(lBuff, (lBuffLen + 1) * sizeof(wchar_t)));
1744  }
1745 
1746  if (lHResult == S_OK || lHResult == S_FALSE)
1747  {
1748  CoUninitialize();
1749  }
1750  return lBuff;
1751 }
1752 
1753 
1754 BOOL CALLBACK BrowseCallbackProcW_enum(HWND hWndChild, LPARAM lParam)
1755 {
1756  wchar_t buf[255];
1757  GetClassNameW(hWndChild, buf, sizeof(buf));
1758  if (wcscmp(buf, L"SysTreeView32") == 0) {
1759  HTREEITEM hNode = TreeView_GetSelection(hWndChild);
1760  TreeView_EnsureVisible(hWndChild, hNode);
1761  return FALSE;
1762  }
1763  return TRUE;
1764 }
1765 
1766 
1767 static int __stdcall BrowseCallbackProcW(HWND hwnd, UINT uMsg, LPARAM lp, LPARAM pData)
1768 {
1769  switch (uMsg) {
1770  case BFFM_INITIALIZED:
1771  SendMessage(hwnd, BFFM_SETSELECTIONW, TRUE, (LPARAM)pData);
1772  break;
1773  case BFFM_SELCHANGED:
1774  EnumChildWindows(hwnd, BrowseCallbackProcW_enum, 0);
1775  }
1776  return 0;
1777 }
1778 
1779 wchar_t * tinyfd_selectFolderDialogW(
1780  wchar_t const * aTitle, /* NULL or "" */
1781  wchar_t const * aDefaultPath) /* NULL or "" */
1782 {
1783  static wchar_t lBuff[MAX_PATH_OR_CMD];
1784  wchar_t * lRetval;
1785 
1786  BROWSEINFOW bInfo;
1787  LPITEMIDLIST lpItem;
1788  HRESULT lHResult;
1789 
1790  if (aTitle&&!wcscmp(aTitle, L"tinyfd_query")){ strcpy(tinyfd_response, "windows_wchar"); return (wchar_t *)1; }
1791 
1792  if (quoteDetectedW(aTitle)) return tinyfd_selectFolderDialogW(L"INVALID TITLE WITH QUOTES", aDefaultPath);
1793  if (quoteDetectedW(aDefaultPath)) return tinyfd_selectFolderDialogW(aTitle, L"INVALID DEFAULT_PATH WITH QUOTES");
1794 
1795  lHResult = CoInitializeEx(NULL, COINIT_APARTMENTTHREADED);
1796 
1797  bInfo.hwndOwner = GetForegroundWindow();
1798  bInfo.pidlRoot = NULL;
1799  bInfo.pszDisplayName = lBuff;
1800  bInfo.lpszTitle = aTitle && wcslen(aTitle) ? aTitle : NULL;
1801  if (lHResult == S_OK || lHResult == S_FALSE)
1802  {
1803  bInfo.ulFlags = BIF_USENEWUI;
1804  }
1805  bInfo.lpfn = BrowseCallbackProcW;
1806  bInfo.lParam = (LPARAM)aDefaultPath;
1807  bInfo.iImage = -1;
1808 
1809  lpItem = SHBrowseForFolderW(&bInfo);
1810  if (!lpItem)
1811  {
1812  lRetval = NULL;
1813  }
1814  else
1815  {
1816  SHGetPathFromIDListW(lpItem, lBuff);
1817  lRetval = lBuff ;
1818  }
1819 
1820  if (lHResult == S_OK || lHResult == S_FALSE)
1821  {
1822  CoUninitialize();
1823  }
1824  return lRetval;
1825 }
1826 
1827 
1828 wchar_t * tinyfd_colorChooserW(
1829  wchar_t const * aTitle, /* NULL or "" */
1830  wchar_t const * aDefaultHexRGB, /* NULL or "#FF0000"*/
1831  unsigned char const aDefaultRGB[3], /* { 0 , 255 , 255 } */
1832  unsigned char aoResultRGB[3]) /* { 0 , 0 , 0 } */
1833 {
1834  static wchar_t lResultHexRGB[8];
1835  CHOOSECOLORW cc;
1836  COLORREF crCustColors[16];
1837  unsigned char lDefaultRGB[3];
1838  int lRet;
1839 
1840  HRESULT lHResult;
1841 
1842  if (aTitle&&!wcscmp(aTitle, L"tinyfd_query")){ strcpy(tinyfd_response, "windows_wchar"); return (wchar_t *)1; }
1843 
1844  if (quoteDetectedW(aTitle)) return tinyfd_colorChooserW(L"INVALID TITLE WITH QUOTES", aDefaultHexRGB, aDefaultRGB, aoResultRGB);
1845  if (quoteDetectedW(aDefaultHexRGB)) return tinyfd_colorChooserW(aTitle, L"INVALID DEFAULT_HEX_RGB WITH QUOTES", aDefaultRGB, aoResultRGB);
1846 
1847  lHResult = CoInitializeEx(NULL, 0);
1848 
1849  if ( aDefaultHexRGB )
1850  {
1851  Hex2RGBW(aDefaultHexRGB, lDefaultRGB);
1852  }
1853  else
1854  {
1855  lDefaultRGB[0] = aDefaultRGB[0];
1856  lDefaultRGB[1] = aDefaultRGB[1];
1857  lDefaultRGB[2] = aDefaultRGB[2];
1858  }
1859 
1860  /* we can't use aTitle */
1861  cc.lStructSize = sizeof(CHOOSECOLOR);
1862  cc.hwndOwner = GetForegroundWindow();
1863  cc.hInstance = NULL;
1864  cc.rgbResult = RGB(lDefaultRGB[0], lDefaultRGB[1], lDefaultRGB[2]);
1865  cc.lpCustColors = crCustColors;
1866  cc.Flags = CC_RGBINIT | CC_FULLOPEN | CC_ANYCOLOR ;
1867  cc.lCustData = 0;
1868  cc.lpfnHook = NULL;
1869  cc.lpTemplateName = NULL;
1870 
1871  lRet = ChooseColorW(&cc);
1872 
1873  if (!lRet)
1874  {
1875  return NULL;
1876  }
1877 
1878  aoResultRGB[0] = GetRValue(cc.rgbResult);
1879  aoResultRGB[1] = GetGValue(cc.rgbResult);
1880  aoResultRGB[2] = GetBValue(cc.rgbResult);
1881 
1882  RGB2HexW(aoResultRGB, lResultHexRGB);
1883 
1884  if (lHResult == S_OK || lHResult == S_FALSE)
1885  {
1886  CoUninitialize();
1887  }
1888 
1889  return lResultHexRGB;
1890 }
1891 
1892 
1893 static int messageBoxWinGui(
1894  char const * aTitle, /* NULL or "" */
1895  char const * aMessage, /* NULL or "" may contain \n and \t */
1896  char const * aDialogType, /* "ok" "okcancel" "yesno" "yesnocancel" */
1897  char const * aIconType, /* "info" "warning" "error" "question" */
1898  int aDefaultButton) /* 0 for cancel/no , 1 for ok/yes , 2 for no in yesnocancel */
1899 {
1900  int lIntRetVal;
1901  wchar_t lTitle[128] = L"";
1902  wchar_t * lMessage = NULL;
1903  wchar_t lDialogType[16] = L"";
1904  wchar_t lIconType[16] = L"";
1905  wchar_t * lTmpWChar;
1906 
1907  if (aTitle)
1908  {
1909  if (tinyfd_winUtf8) lTmpWChar = tinyfd_utf8to16(aTitle);
1910  else lTmpWChar = tinyfd_mbcsTo16(aTitle);
1911  wcscpy(lTitle, lTmpWChar);
1912  }
1913  if (aMessage)
1914  {
1915  if (tinyfd_winUtf8) lTmpWChar = tinyfd_utf8to16(aMessage);
1916  else lTmpWChar = tinyfd_mbcsTo16(aMessage);
1917  lMessage = (wchar_t *) malloc((wcslen(lTmpWChar) + 1)* sizeof(wchar_t));
1918  if (lMessage) wcscpy(lMessage, lTmpWChar);
1919  }
1920  if (aDialogType)
1921  {
1922  if (tinyfd_winUtf8) lTmpWChar = tinyfd_utf8to16(aDialogType);
1923  else lTmpWChar = tinyfd_mbcsTo16(aDialogType);
1924  wcscpy(lDialogType, lTmpWChar);
1925  }
1926  if (aIconType)
1927  {
1928  if (tinyfd_winUtf8) lTmpWChar = tinyfd_utf8to16(aIconType);
1929  else lTmpWChar = tinyfd_mbcsTo16(aIconType);
1930  wcscpy(lIconType, lTmpWChar);
1931  }
1932 
1933  lIntRetVal = tinyfd_messageBoxW(lTitle, lMessage, lDialogType, lIconType, aDefaultButton);
1934 
1935  free(lMessage);
1936 
1937  return lIntRetVal;
1938 }
1939 
1940 
1941 static int notifyWinGui(
1942  char const * aTitle, /* NULL or "" */
1943  char const * aMessage, /* NULL or "" may NOT contain \n nor \t */
1944  char const * aIconType)
1945 {
1946  wchar_t lTitle[128] = L"";
1947  wchar_t * lMessage = NULL;
1948  wchar_t lIconType[16] = L"";
1949  wchar_t * lTmpWChar;
1950 
1951  if (aTitle)
1952  {
1953  if (tinyfd_winUtf8) lTmpWChar = tinyfd_utf8to16(aTitle);
1954  else lTmpWChar = tinyfd_mbcsTo16(aTitle);
1955  wcscpy(lTitle, lTmpWChar);
1956  }
1957  if (aMessage)
1958  {
1959  if (tinyfd_winUtf8) lTmpWChar = tinyfd_utf8to16(aMessage);
1960  else lTmpWChar = tinyfd_mbcsTo16(aMessage);
1961  lMessage = (wchar_t *) malloc((wcslen(lTmpWChar) + 1)* sizeof(wchar_t));
1962  if (lMessage) wcscpy(lMessage, lTmpWChar);
1963  }
1964  if (aIconType)
1965  {
1966  if (tinyfd_winUtf8) lTmpWChar = tinyfd_utf8to16(aIconType);
1967  else lTmpWChar = tinyfd_mbcsTo16(aIconType);
1968  wcscpy(lIconType, lTmpWChar);
1969  }
1970 
1971  tinyfd_notifyPopupW(lTitle, lMessage, lIconType);
1972 
1973  free(lMessage);
1974 
1975  return 1;
1976 }
1977 
1978 
1979 static int inputBoxWinGui(
1980  char * aoBuff,
1981  char const * aTitle, /* NULL or "" */
1982  char const * aMessage, /* NULL or "" may NOT contain \n nor \t */
1983  char const * aDefaultInput) /* "" , if NULL it's a passwordBox */
1984 {
1985  wchar_t lTitle[128] = L"";
1986  wchar_t * lMessage = NULL;
1987  wchar_t lDefaultInput[MAX_PATH_OR_CMD] = L"";
1988  wchar_t * lTmpWChar;
1989  char * lTmpChar;
1990 
1991  if (aTitle)
1992  {
1993  if (tinyfd_winUtf8) lTmpWChar = tinyfd_utf8to16(aTitle);
1994  else lTmpWChar = tinyfd_mbcsTo16(aTitle);
1995  wcscpy(lTitle, lTmpWChar);
1996  }
1997  if (aMessage)
1998  {
1999  if (tinyfd_winUtf8) lTmpWChar = tinyfd_utf8to16(aMessage);
2000  else lTmpWChar = tinyfd_mbcsTo16(aMessage);
2001  lMessage = (wchar_t *) malloc((wcslen(lTmpWChar) + 1)* sizeof(wchar_t));
2002  if (lMessage) wcscpy(lMessage, lTmpWChar);
2003  }
2004  if (aDefaultInput)
2005  {
2006  if (tinyfd_winUtf8) lTmpWChar = tinyfd_utf8to16(aDefaultInput);
2007  else lTmpWChar = tinyfd_mbcsTo16(aDefaultInput);
2008  wcscpy(lDefaultInput, lTmpWChar);
2009  lTmpWChar = tinyfd_inputBoxW(lTitle, lMessage, lDefaultInput);
2010  }
2011  else lTmpWChar = tinyfd_inputBoxW(lTitle, lMessage, NULL);
2012 
2013  free(lMessage);
2014 
2015  if (!lTmpWChar)
2016  {
2017  aoBuff[0] = '\0';
2018  return 0;
2019  }
2020 
2021  if (tinyfd_winUtf8) lTmpChar = tinyfd_utf16to8(lTmpWChar);
2022  else lTmpChar = tinyfd_utf16toMbcs(lTmpWChar);
2023 
2024  strcpy(aoBuff, lTmpChar);
2025 
2026  return 1;
2027 }
2028 
2029 
2030 static char * saveFileDialogWinGui(
2031  char * aoBuff,
2032  char const * aTitle, /* NULL or "" */
2033  char const * aDefaultPathAndFile, /* NULL or "" */
2034  int aNumOfFilterPatterns, /* 0 */
2035  char const * const * aFilterPatterns, /* NULL or {"*.jpg","*.png"} */
2036  char const * aSingleFilterDescription) /* NULL or "image files" */
2037 {
2038  wchar_t lTitle[128] = L"";
2039  wchar_t lDefaultPathAndFile[MAX_PATH_OR_CMD] = L"";
2040  wchar_t lSingleFilterDescription[128] = L"";
2041  wchar_t * * lFilterPatterns;
2042  wchar_t * lTmpWChar;
2043  char * lTmpChar;
2044  int i;
2045 
2046  lFilterPatterns = (wchar_t **)malloc(aNumOfFilterPatterns*sizeof(wchar_t *));
2047  for (i = 0; i < aNumOfFilterPatterns; i++)
2048  {
2049  if (tinyfd_winUtf8) lTmpWChar = tinyfd_utf8to16(aFilterPatterns[i]);
2050  else lTmpWChar = tinyfd_mbcsTo16(aFilterPatterns[i]);
2051  lFilterPatterns[i] = (wchar_t *)malloc((wcslen(lTmpWChar) + 1) * sizeof(wchar_t *));
2052  if (lFilterPatterns[i]) wcscpy(lFilterPatterns[i], lTmpWChar);
2053  }
2054 
2055  if (aTitle)
2056  {
2057  if (tinyfd_winUtf8) lTmpWChar = tinyfd_utf8to16(aTitle);
2058  else lTmpWChar = tinyfd_mbcsTo16(aTitle);
2059  wcscpy(lTitle, lTmpWChar);
2060  }
2061  if (aDefaultPathAndFile)
2062  {
2063  if (tinyfd_winUtf8) lTmpWChar = tinyfd_utf8to16(aDefaultPathAndFile);
2064  else lTmpWChar = tinyfd_mbcsTo16(aDefaultPathAndFile);
2065  wcscpy(lDefaultPathAndFile, lTmpWChar);
2066  }
2067  if (aSingleFilterDescription)
2068  {
2069  if (tinyfd_winUtf8) lTmpWChar = tinyfd_utf8to16(aSingleFilterDescription);
2070  else lTmpWChar = tinyfd_mbcsTo16(aSingleFilterDescription);
2071  wcscpy(lSingleFilterDescription, lTmpWChar);
2072  }
2073 
2074  lTmpWChar = tinyfd_saveFileDialogW(
2075  lTitle,
2076  lDefaultPathAndFile,
2077  aNumOfFilterPatterns,
2078  (wchar_t const**) lFilterPatterns, /*stupid cast for gcc*/
2079  lSingleFilterDescription);
2080 
2081  for (i = 0; i < aNumOfFilterPatterns; i++)
2082  {
2083  free(lFilterPatterns[i]);
2084  }
2085  free(lFilterPatterns);
2086 
2087  if (!lTmpWChar)
2088  {
2089  return NULL;
2090  }
2091 
2092  if (tinyfd_winUtf8) lTmpChar = tinyfd_utf16to8(lTmpWChar);
2093  else lTmpChar = tinyfd_utf16toMbcs(lTmpWChar);
2094  strcpy(aoBuff, lTmpChar);
2095  if (tinyfd_winUtf8) (void)tinyfd_utf16to8(NULL);
2096  else (void)tinyfd_utf16toMbcs(NULL);
2097 
2098  return aoBuff;
2099 }
2100 
2101 
2102 static char * openFileDialogWinGui(
2103  char const * aTitle, /* NULL or "" */
2104  char const * aDefaultPathAndFile, /* NULL or "" */
2105  int aNumOfFilterPatterns, /* 0 */
2106  char const * const * aFilterPatterns, /* NULL or {"*.jpg","*.png"} */
2107  char const * aSingleFilterDescription, /* NULL or "image files" */
2108  int aAllowMultipleSelects) /* 0 or 1 */
2109 {
2110  wchar_t lTitle[128] = L"";
2111  wchar_t lDefaultPathAndFile[MAX_PATH_OR_CMD] = L"";
2112  wchar_t lSingleFilterDescription[128] = L"";
2113  wchar_t * * lFilterPatterns;
2114  wchar_t * lTmpWChar;
2115  char * lTmpChar;
2116  int i;
2117 
2118  lFilterPatterns = (wchar_t * *)malloc(aNumOfFilterPatterns*sizeof(wchar_t *));
2119  for (i = 0; i < aNumOfFilterPatterns; i++)
2120  {
2121  if (tinyfd_winUtf8) lTmpWChar = tinyfd_utf8to16(aFilterPatterns[i]);
2122  else lTmpWChar = tinyfd_mbcsTo16(aFilterPatterns[i]);
2123  lFilterPatterns[i] = (wchar_t *)malloc((wcslen(lTmpWChar) + 1)*sizeof(wchar_t *));
2124  if (lFilterPatterns[i]) wcscpy(lFilterPatterns[i], lTmpWChar);
2125  }
2126 
2127  if (aTitle)
2128  {
2129  if (tinyfd_winUtf8) lTmpWChar = tinyfd_utf8to16(aTitle);
2130  else lTmpWChar = tinyfd_mbcsTo16(aTitle);
2131  wcscpy(lTitle, lTmpWChar);
2132  }
2133  if (aDefaultPathAndFile)
2134  {
2135  if (tinyfd_winUtf8) lTmpWChar = tinyfd_utf8to16(aDefaultPathAndFile);
2136  else lTmpWChar = tinyfd_mbcsTo16(aDefaultPathAndFile);
2137  wcscpy(lDefaultPathAndFile, lTmpWChar);
2138  }
2139  if (aSingleFilterDescription)
2140  {
2141  if (tinyfd_winUtf8) lTmpWChar = tinyfd_utf8to16(aSingleFilterDescription);
2142  else lTmpWChar = tinyfd_mbcsTo16(aSingleFilterDescription);
2143  wcscpy(lSingleFilterDescription, lTmpWChar);
2144  }
2145 
2146  lTmpWChar = tinyfd_openFileDialogW(
2147  lTitle,
2148  lDefaultPathAndFile,
2149  aNumOfFilterPatterns,
2150  (wchar_t const**) lFilterPatterns, /*stupid cast for gcc*/
2151  lSingleFilterDescription,
2152  aAllowMultipleSelects);
2153 
2154  for (i = 0; i < aNumOfFilterPatterns; i++)
2155  {
2156  free(lFilterPatterns[i]);
2157  }
2158  free(lFilterPatterns);
2159 
2160  if (!lTmpWChar) return NULL;
2161 
2162  if (tinyfd_winUtf8) lTmpChar = tinyfd_utf16to8(lTmpWChar);
2163  else lTmpChar = tinyfd_utf16toMbcs(lTmpWChar);
2164  (void)tinyfd_openFileDialogW(NULL, NULL, 0, NULL, NULL, -1);
2165 
2166  return lTmpChar;
2167 }
2168 
2169 
2170 static char * selectFolderDialogWinGui(
2171  char * aoBuff,
2172  char const * aTitle, /* NULL or "" */
2173  char const * aDefaultPath) /* NULL or "" */
2174 {
2175  wchar_t lTitle[128] = L"";
2176  wchar_t lDefaultPath[MAX_PATH_OR_CMD] = L"";
2177  wchar_t * lTmpWChar;
2178  char * lTmpChar;
2179 
2180  if (aTitle)
2181  {
2182  if (tinyfd_winUtf8) lTmpWChar = tinyfd_utf8to16(aTitle);
2183  else lTmpWChar = tinyfd_mbcsTo16(aTitle);
2184  wcscpy(lTitle, lTmpWChar);
2185  }
2186  if (aDefaultPath)
2187  {
2188  if (tinyfd_winUtf8) lTmpWChar = tinyfd_utf8to16(aDefaultPath);
2189  else lTmpWChar = tinyfd_mbcsTo16(aDefaultPath);
2190  wcscpy(lDefaultPath, lTmpWChar);
2191  }
2192 
2193  lTmpWChar = tinyfd_selectFolderDialogW(
2194  lTitle,
2195  lDefaultPath);
2196 
2197  if (!lTmpWChar)
2198  {
2199  return NULL;
2200  }
2201 
2202  if (tinyfd_winUtf8) lTmpChar = tinyfd_utf16to8(lTmpWChar);
2203  else lTmpChar = tinyfd_utf16toMbcs(lTmpWChar);
2204  strcpy(aoBuff, lTmpChar);
2205 
2206  return aoBuff;
2207 }
